title: Lambie backs the Springboks for World Cup glory
text:
Cape Town - Recently retired Pat Lambie anticipates a good result for South Africa this weekend with the former star firmly believing the Springboks can win the Rugby World Cup in Japan.

“There’s something special about this team,” Lambie says on Wednesday night's episode of The Dan Nicholl Show, showing at 19:00 on SuperSport 8.

“I’ve spoken to a few guys in the squad, and they’re in a good place. They’ve got to the final without playing quite as well as they probably can, so I think they have a good chance of winning.”

Lambie also offers his thoughts on England.

“They’ve had two really big weekends, and the game against New Zealand was the best this England team has played together. But now they’ll need another huge performance.”

The 56-Test Bok also offers counsel for the build-up to the game.

“You’ve got to keep busy, try to stay relaxed, not get too worked up about the final. But Siya and the guys will know that - they’ve played a lot of big games.”

Lambie isn’t the only one on the show anticipating a South African victory in Japan - rugby-mad author Deon Meyer is also calling a Springbok victory.

“I definitely think we’re going to win it,” predicts the acclaimed thriller writer, who famously named one of his villains Romaine Poite after the French referee.

“I’ve been watching a lot of the games, and I’m feeling confident.”

Meyer also speaks proudly of the new M-Net series trackers, based on his bestselling novel of the same name.

“I was nervous before I saw the first episode, because M-Net hyped the series up a lot. But they’ve done a terrific job, with the filming, the script, the actors. As the author, I’m very happy.”

Having recently sold his motorbike and changed his two-wheel hobby to mountain biking, Meyer also entertains the idea of setting a future novel around the Cape Epic.

There’s also a Schalk on the show this week, but not Burger or Brits - comedian Schalk Bezuidenhout makes an appearance ahead of this weekend’s Big 5 Comedy show in Cape Town, and just after his engagement, which he details with full comedy value.

Fellow comedian Joey Rasdien also makes an appearance, as he joins host Dan Nicholl for an archery challenge at Albie Morkel and Jo Black’s Ultimate Aim in Pretoria, and Nedbank Golf Challenge tournament director Ken Payet confirms Ernie Els' appearance at the tournament, and gives an update on what’s planned for local golf’s biggest event.

The Dan Nicholl Show, presented by BrightRock, premieres every Wednesday night on SuperSport 8 at 19:00, and is available on ShowMax, Catch-up and DSTV Plus.
